title: Portfolio Manager
summary: A single-tenant family-office web platform that tracks assets and transactions, computes holdings and allocation in EUR, and provides authenticated portfolio operations dashboards.
description:
Portfolio Manager is my secure operating system for capital allocation. It centralizes assets, transactions, valuation, and allocation drift in one authenticated interface. The stack combines Next.js, TypeScript, PostgreSQL/Prisma, and a modular provider layer for prices, FX, news, and financial statements.

The platform includes a valuation engine for holdings and equity history, rule-based allocation and rebalance workflows, and admin refresh orchestration to keep market and reference data current. It is built for disciplined, single-user family-office management with production-grade API surfaces and operational controls.
highlights: End-to-end portfolio engine: holdings, P&L, allocation, and equity snapshots in EUR
Provider architecture for prices, FX, news, and financial data with fallback logic
Authenticated operations UI for dashboard, assets, transactions, and rebalance actions
Automated refresh pipelines with cron endpoint, validation safeguards, and Dockerized setup

title: Extended Market Maker
summary: A standalone market maker engine for Extended, optimized by AI for execution quality and expectancy with dynamic quoting and inventory-aware risk controls.
description: Extended Market Maker is a production-oriented quoting system focused on quality fills rather than raw fill count. It combines dynamic spread-based offsets, repricing hysteresis, post-only rejection handling, toxicity guards, stale-book protection, and circuit-breaker logic. This project is deployed on a Raspberry Pi and controlled by OpenClaw, which adjusts market-making parameters in real time based on live conditions.
highlights: Dynamic quoting with min/max offset clamps and adaptive repricing gates
Inventory-aware skew with deadband, nonlinear shaping, and bps caps
Microstructure safeguards for volatility, drift, imbalance, and stale books
Live parameter tuning via OpenClaw control loop on Raspberry Pi

title: Accordion - Pair trading Bot
summary: A statistical arbitrage bot for perpetual futures on Extended Exchange, focused on cointegration and spread mean reversion with paper, dry-run, and real trading modes.
description: Accordion is a production-oriented statistical arbitrage system for crypto perpetual futures. It discovers cointegrated pairs, computes spread and z-score signals, and executes mean-reversion strategies with strict risk controls. The system supports paper, dry-run, and real trading, and includes state persistence, monitoring endpoints, and data pipelines for pair selection.
highlights: Cointegration and half-life based pair discovery pipeline
Signal engine with z-score entry and exit logic
Risk layer with exposure limits, kill switch, and guardrails
Operational tooling for logs, API visibility, and strategy state export
